intro: Acropera pallida, commonly known as the pale acropera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, pale green or white flowers. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Acropera pallida is relatively uncommon and is sometimes considered a rare species within its native habitat.
